Cloud Step: May Stride over insubstantial surfaces and traps

Light Step: May Stride or Step normally over difficult terrain

Assurance (Cave Lore): May forgo rolling a Cave Lore check for an automatic 34

Delay Trap: (R) May attempt a +5 DC Thievery to delay or disable trap activation
Dubious Knowledge: Failure on a Recall Knowledge check yields a mix of true and false information
Expeditious Search: May Search at 4x normal Speed
Group Impression: May use Diplomacy to Make an Impression with 2 targets
Intimidating Glare: May use glare to Demoralize
Quick Squeeze: May Squeeze at full Speed
Sabotage: (1) May use Thievery vs. Reflex to inflict 62 HP damage (critical success 124 HP) to an item possessed by a creature within reach
Sense The Unseen: (R) Upon a failed Seek, may make undetected foes hidden
Sneak Savant: Normal failures on Sneak actions are successes
Subtle Theft: Successful Steal inflicts -2 Perception on observers to detect/May remain undetected when using Palm an Object or Steal after a successful Create a Diversion
Trap Finder: +2 AC vs. traps
Wary Disarmament: +2 AC vs. a trap triggered while disarming it
Combat
Hit Points: 248 Armor Class: 40 (dexterity (3 max); master) Class DC: Rogue: 26 (dexterity; master)
Armor: Studded Leather Shield: None Weapons: Fist (+31 1d4+4 B; dexterity; master); Sickle (+31 1d4+4 S; dexterity; master); Spiked Gauntlet (+30 1d4+4 P; strength; master)
Combat Notes:
Constitution Hit Points Adjustment: +80
Dexterity Armor Class Adjustment: +3
Dexterity Attack Adjustment: +5
Greater Weapon Specialization: Increased Weapon Specialization effects
Light Armor Expertise: Defense Expert (Light Armor; Unarmored Defense)
Light Armor Mastery: Defense Master (Light Armor; Unarmored Defense)
Master Strike: (F) Class Master (Rogue)
Master Tricks: Attack Master (Simple Weapons; Rapier; Sap; Shortbow; Shortsword; Unarmed Attacks)
Rogue Expertise: Class Expert (Rogue)
Ruffian: Defense Master (Medium Armor)
Strength Attack Adjustment: +4
Unconventional Expertise: Attack Expert (Choose 1 from any)
Unconventional Weaponry: Attack Trained (Choose 1 from any)/Treats chosen weapon as one category simpler
Weapon Proficiency (Bastard Sword): Attack Trained (Bastard Sword)
Weapon Proficiency (Simple Weapons): Attack Trained (Simple Weapons)
Weapon Tricks: Attack Expert (Simple Weapons; Rapier; Sap; Shortbow; Shortsword; Unarmed Attacks)
Battle Assessment: (1) May use Perception vs. Deception or Stealth DC to determine foe strengths and weaknesses
Blind-Fight: May attack concealed foes without a prior check and hidden creatures with a DC 5 check/Does not suffer flat-footed with hidden foes
Brutal Beating: Critical success on a Strike inflicts frightened 1
Critical Debilitation: Debilitating Strike may force a foe Fortitude save; critical failure paralyzes until the end of next turn; failure/success inflicts slowed 2/1 until the end of next turn
Debilitating Strike: (F) May have a successful Strike against a flat-footed foe inflict choice of -10 Speed or enfeebled 1 until end of next turn
Defensive Roll: (F) May negate half damage from an attack that would reduce self to 0 HP 1/10 min
Deny Advantage: Does not suffer flat-footed to foes of equal or lower level
Dispelling Slice: (2) May attempt a level 10, DC 16 counteract to dispel a magical effect on the target of a successful sneak attack
Distracting Feint: A successful Feint inflicts -2 Perception and Reflex saves
Double Debilitation: Debilitating Strike inflicts choice of two debilitations
Dread Striker: Frightened foes are flat-footed vs. self attacks
Elf Step: (1) May take two 5' Steps
Fantastic Leap: (2) May Strike after a High Jump or Long Jump, using Long Jump distance for either
Felling Shot: (2) May force a Reflex save with a successful Strike vs. an airborne flat-footed foe; critical failure grounds until the end of next turn; failure causes 120' fall
Gang Up: Flanking by allies inflict flat-footed on foes vs. self attacks
Impossible Striker: May inflict sneak attack damage on a non-flat-footed foe
Improved Poison Weapon: Poisoned weapons inflict +2d4 HP damage/Critical miss does not waste poison
Instant Opening: (1) R30' May use a distraction to inflict flat-footed vs. self until the end of next turn
Leave An Opening: May follow a critical hit on a flat-footed foe by giving a chosen ally an Attack Of Opportunity
Master Strike: (F) May have a successful Strike on a flat-footed foe force a Fortitude save 1/target/day; critical failure inflicts choice of paralyzed for 4 rd, knocked unconscious for 2 hours, or killed; failure inflicts paralyzed for 4 rd; success inflicts enfeebled 2 for 1 rd
Mobility: May Stride half Speed without triggering reactions
Nimble Dodge: (R) May gain +2 AC against an attack
Opportune Backstab: (R) After an ally hits a foe, may Strike the same foe
Poison Weapon: (1) May prepare 20 poisons each day that inflict 1d4 HP damage/May apply poison to piercing and slashing weapons
Powerful Sneak: May change sneak attack damage to match weapon type
Precise Debilitations: Debilitating Strike may inflict +2d6 HP precision damage or flat-footed
Quick Draw: (1) May draw a weapon and Strike
Reactive Distraction: (R) May redirect an effect or attack from self to Perfect Distraction decoy
Reactive Interference: (R) May prevent a foe Reaction; requires an attack against a higher-level foe
Reactive Pursuit: (R) May remain adjacent to a retreating foe
Ruffian: May sneak attack with any simple weapon/May apply critical specialization on a critical hit with a d8 or lighter simple weapon on a flat-footed foe
Scoundrel: A successful Feint inflicts flat-footed on foe vs. self attacks (critical success all attacks) for until the end of next turn
Scout's Warning: (F) May give allies +1 initiative
Sidestep: (R) May redirect a failed Strike on self to an adjacent creature
Skirmish Strike: (1) May Step and Strike
Sly Striker: Successful Strikes with a sneak attack weapon inflict +2d6 HP precision damage
Sneak Attack: +4d6 HP damage vs. flat-footed foe with agile, finesse, or ranged weapons
Spring From The Shadows: (1) May Strike an unaware foe after a Stride
Surprise Attack: May use Deception or Stealth for initiative to inflict flat-footed on creatures that haven't acted
Tactical Debilitations: Debilitating Strike may prevent reactions or flanking
Thief: +1 HP damage with finesse melee weapons
Trap Finder: +2 Perception and automatic Search to find traps/May disable traps that require legendary in Thievery
Twin Feint: (2) May Strike with each hand, inflicting flat-footed on the second
Twist The Knife: (1) May inflict 4 HP persistent bleed damage with a sneak attack
Unbalancing Blow: Critical hits inflict flat-footed vs. self attacks until the end of next turn
Vicious Debilitations: Debilitating Strike may inflict weakness 5 to choice of damage type or clumsy 1
Weapon Specialization: +4/+6/+8 HP damage with expert/master/legendary weapon proficiency
Weapon Tricks: Critical hits vs. a flat-footed foe with unarmed attacks and agile, finesse, and rogue weapons inflict its critical specialization effect
You're Next: (R) May gain +2 Intimidation to Demoralize another foe after current foe drops
Save: Fortitude: +28 (constitution; expert); Reflex: +33 (dexterity; legendary); Will: +30 (wisdom; master)
Save Notes:
Canny Acumen (Will): Save Master (Will)
Evasion: Save Master (Reflex)
Great Fortitude: Save Expert (Fortitude)
Improved Evasion: Save Legendary (Reflex)
Slippery Mind: Save Master (Will)
Blank Slate: Immune to detection, revelation and scrying effects of less than 10 counteract level
Cognitive Loophole: (R) May suppress a mental effect until the end of next turn
Evasion: Successes on Reflex saves are critical successes
Fast Recovery: Regains 2x Hit Points and drained severity from rest/Successful Fortitude vs. an ongoing disease or poison reduces its stage by 2, or 1 if virulent; critical success by 3, or 2 if virulent
Improved Evasion: Critical failures on Reflex saves are normal failures/Suffers half normal damage from failed Reflex saves
Nimble Roll: May use Nimble Dodge before a Reflex save; success allows a 10' Stride
Slippery Mind: Successes on Will saves are critical successes
Trap Finder: +2 vs. traps
